intro: Pedicularis resupinata f. ramosa, commonly known as the branched monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its unique, pendulous flowers that resemble small monkeys. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are typically pink or purple and are pollinated by insects such as bees and flies.
